remixlab.bias.agent

Class ActionWheeledMotionAgent<W extends MotionProfile<?>,M extends MotionProfile<?>,C extends ClickProfile<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionAgent<M>
        • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionMotionAgent<M,C>
          • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionWheeledMotionAgent<W,M,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    W - MotionProfile to parameterize the Agent with.
    M - MotionProfile to parameterize the Agent with.
    C - ClickProfile to parameterize the Agent with.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent

    public class ActionWheeledMotionAgent<W extends MotionProfile<?>,M extends MotionProfile<?>,C extends ClickProfile<?>>
extends ActionMotionAgent<M,C>
    A ActionMotionAgent with an extra MotionProfile defining ButtonShortcut -> Action mappings.

    The Agent thus is defined by three profiles: the ActionMotionAgent.motionProfile() (alias for ActionAgent.profile() provided for convenience), the ActionMotionAgent.clickProfile() and the extra wheelProfile().

      • handle

        public void handle(BogusEvent event)
        Description copied from class: ActionAgent
        Overriding of the Agent main method. The ActionAgent.profile() is used to parse the event into an user-defined action which is then enqueued as an event-grabber tuple ( Agent.enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple)), used to instruct the Agent.inputGrabber() the user-defined action to perform.

        Note 1: ActionAgent.alienGrabber()s always make the tuple to be enqueued even if the action is null (see Agent.enqueueEventTuple(EventGrabberTuple, boolean)).

        Note 2: This method should be overridden only in the (rare) case the ActionAgent should deal with custom BogusEvents defined by the third-party, i.e., bogus events different than those declared in the remixlab.bias.event package.

        Overrides:
        handle in class ActionMotionAgent<M extends MotionProfile<?>,C extends ClickProfile<?>>
        See Also:
        Agent.inputGrabber()
